content.text: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cubed
content.eamr: ( ing-0 "1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cubed" )

content.text: 1 cup sliced carrots
content.eamr: ( ing-1 "1 cup sliced carrots" )

content.text: 1 cup frozen green peas
content.eamr: ( ing-2 "1 cup frozen green peas" )

content.text: 1/2 cup sliced celery
content.eamr: ( ing-3 "1/2 cup sliced celery" )

content.text: 1/3 cup butter
content.eamr: ( ing-4 "1/3 cup butter" )

content.text: 1/3 cup chopped onion
content.eamr: ( ing-5 "1/3 cup chopped onion" )

content.text: 1/3 cup all-purpose flour
content.eamr: ( ing-6 "1/3 cup all-purpose flour" )

content.text: 1/2 teaspoon salt
content.eamr: ( ing-7 "1/2 teaspoon salt" )

content.text: 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
content.eamr: ( ing-8 "1/4 teaspoon black pepper" )

content.text: 1/4 teaspoon celery seed
content.eamr: ( ing-9 "1/4 teaspoon celery seed" )

content.text: 1 3/4 cups chicken broth
content.eamr: ( ing-10 "1 3/4 cups chicken broth" )

content.text: 2/3 cup milk
content.eamr: ( ing-11 "2/3 cup milk" )

content.text: 2 (9 inch)  unbaked pie crusts
content.eamr: ( ing-12 "2 (9 inch)  unbaked pie crusts" )

content.text: 0) Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "Preheat"@3:10 / AC
		:ppt ( tool-0-0 "oven"@11:15 / TOOL )
		:heat ( temp-0-0 "425 degrees F"@19:32 / TEMPERATURE )
		:heat ( temp-0-1 "220 degrees C"@34:47 / TEMPERATURE )
	)
)

content.text: 1) In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas, and celery.
content.eamr:
( inst-1 / R
	:inform ( ac-1-0 "combine"@18:25 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-0 "chicken"@26:33 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "carrots"@35:42 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "peas"@44:48 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "celery"@54:60 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-1-0 "a saucepan"@6:16 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 2) Add water to cover and boil for 15 minutes.
3) Remove from heat, drain and set aside.
4) In the saucepan over medium heat, cook onions in butter until soft and translucent.
content.eamr:
( inst-4 / R
	:inform ( ac-4-0 "cook"@37:41 / AC
		:loc ( tool-4-0 "the saucepan"@6:18 / TOOL )
		:heat ( "medium heat"@24:35 / OTHER )
		:ppt ( ing-5 "onions"@42:48 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-4 "butter"@52:58 / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-4-0 "until soft and translucent"@59:85 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 5) Stir in flour, salt, pepper, and celery seed.
content.eamr:
( inst-5 / R
	:inform ( ac-5-0 "Stir in"@3:10 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-6 "flour"@11:16 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-7 "salt"@18:22 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-8 "pepper"@24:30 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-9 "celery seed"@36:47 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 6) Slowly stir in chicken broth and milk.
content.eamr:
( inst-6 / R
	:inform ( ac-6-0 "stir in"@10:17 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-10 "chicken broth"@18:31 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-11 "milk"@36:40 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 7) Simmer over medium-low heat until thick.
content.eamr:
( inst-7 / R
	:inform ( ac-7-0 "Simmer"@3:9 / AC
		:heat ( "medium-low heat"@15:30 / OTHER )
		:until ( cond-7-0 "until thick"@31:42 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 8) Remove from heat and set aside.
9) Place the chicken mixture in bottom pie crust.
10) Pour hot liquid mixture over.
11) Cover with top crust, seal edges, and cut away excess dough.
12) Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape.
content.eamr:
( inst-12 / R
	:inform ( ac-12-0 "Make"@4:8 / AC
		:ppt ( "several small slits"@9:28 / FOOD )
		:loc ( "the top"@32:39 / FOOD )
		:prp ( purp-12-0 "to allow steam to escape"@40:64 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 13) Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly.
content.eamr:
( inst-13 / R
	:inform ( ac-13-0 "Bake in"@4:11 / AC
		:loc ( tool-13-0 "the preheated oven"@12:30 / TOOL )
		:duration ( dur-13-0 "30 to 35 minutes"@35:51 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-13-0 "until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly"@56:106 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 14) Cool for 10 minutes before serving.
